SENT.plain: A young man developed intracranial hypertension immediately after myelography with non-ionic water-soluble contrast medium (iopamidol)
Cerebral angiography showed extensive cerebral venous thrombosis
The common causes of thrombophlebitis were excluded
A relationship to the contrast medium was strongly suspected, since a similar case has been reported
The rheological properties and haemo-concentration induced by iopamidol could explain this complication
